comp-ineq0.png.description: A numberline with 8 dots. The 3 red dots are located at -1, 0 and 9. The 5 green dots are located at 1.6, 3, 5.2, 7 and 8.1. The numberline is shaded blueish between 0 and 8.1
comp-ineq0.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

comp-ineq1.png.description: A numberline with 8 red dots at -1, 0, 1.6, 3.2, 5.2, 7, 8.1 and 9.
comp-ineq1.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

comp-ineq2.png.description: A numberline with 8 dots. The 7 red dots are located at -1, 0 1.6, 3, 7, 8.1 and 9. The green dot is located at 5.2. The numberline is shaded blueish between 3 and 7.
comp-ineq2.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

comp-ineq3.png.description: A numberline with 8 green dots at -1, 0, 1.6, 3.2, 5.2, 7, 8.1 and 9.
comp-ineq3.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

comp-ineq4.png.description: A numberline with 8 dots. The 6 green dots are located at -1, 0, 1.6, 7, 8.1 and 9. The red dots are located at 3 and 5.2. The numberline is shaded blueish to the left of 3 and to the right of 7.
comp-ineq4.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

intersection1.png.caption: x > 5 and x ≤ 15
intersection1.png.description: A compound inequality displayed on a number line, showing that the inequalities intersect between 5 and 15. The dot on 5 is red. The dot on 15 is green.
intersection1.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

union-infinite1.png.caption: x > 5 or x ≤ 15
union-infinite1.png.description: A compound inequality displayed on a number line, showing an infinite union
union-infinite1.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

intersection-ns.png.caption: x < 5 and x ≥ 15
intersection-ns.png.description: A compound inequality displayed on a number line, showing no intersection and therefore no solutions
intersection-ns.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

union1.png.caption: x < 5 or x ≥ 15
union1.png.description: A compound inequality displayed on a number line, shaded when numbers are below 5 or greater than 15. The dot on 5 is red and the dot on 15 is green.
union1.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret

lt5orlte15.png.caption: x < 5 or x ≤ 15
lt5orlte15.png.description: A compound inequality displayed on a number line, shaded when numbers are below 3. The dots on 3, 3.5, 4 and 5 are red and the dots on -5, -2.1, 0 and 1 are green.
lt5orlte15.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team in Pyret
